page.title: 06Ecology,
page.content: Mink, bred in the wild, have been caught in traps set for coypu near the Kings Fleet. Seals have been seen in the River Deben. hedgehogs thrive and it has been a good year for frogs, toads, newts and sand lizards. there are too many bats in falkenham church, being a protected species. There are swans on what are left of the marshes and these cause damage to crops, especially when numbers multyply in the winter. Flocks of geese also do damage by treading down crops. Wading birds, Marsh Harriers, Hen Hammers, Heron are to be seen and there are Moorhens and Tufted Buck on King's Fleet. There are large flocks of Golden Plover, Widgeon and Shell Duck nest. Barn owls, Tawney owls and little owls breed in the area, migrant ScradEared owls decreasing due to changed habitat
